info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 8:31AM EST until December 18 at 7:12PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Schuylkill River At Berne affecting Berks County. For the Schuylkill River...including Berne...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Schuylkill River at Berne. * WHEN...From this morning to this evening. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Open adjacent land begins to flood between Shoemakersville and Hamburg. At 12.0 feet, Miller Street in Shoemakersville floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM EST Monday the stage was 12.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 AM EST Monday was 12.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value of 12.1 feet this afternoon. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.1 feet on 04/02/1970. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Stg Time Date Schuylkill River Berne 12.0 12.1 Mon 8 am 9.1 8.3 12.1 1pm 12/18 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued later this morningthis evening at 715 PM EST.
